mal:fundamental.name: Attribute
mal:fundamental.comment: Attribute is the base type of all attributes of the MAL data model. Attributes are contained within Composites and are used to build complex structures that make the data model.

mal:fundamental.name: Composite
mal:fundamental.comment: Composite is the base structure for composite structures that contain a set of elements.

mal:fundamental.name: Element
mal:fundamental.comment: Element is the base type of all data constructs. All types that make up the MAL data model are derived from it.

mal:attribute.name: Blob
mal:attribute.comment: The Blob structure is used to store binary object attributes. It is a variable-length, unbounded, octet array. The distinction between this type and a list of Octet attributes is that this type may allow language mappings and encodings to use more efficient or appropriate representations.

mal:attribute.name: Boolean
mal:attribute.comment: The Boolean structure is used to store Boolean attributes. Possible values are 'True' or 'False'.

mal:attribute.name: Duration
mal:attribute.comment: The Duration structure is used to store Duration attributes. It represents a length of time in seconds. It may contain a fractional component.

mal:attribute.name: Float
mal:attribute.comment: The Float structure is used to store floating point attributes using the IEEE 754 32-bit range. Three special values exist for this type: POSITIVE_INFINITY, NEGATIVE_INFINITY, and NaN (Not A Number).

mal:attribute.name: Double
mal:attribute.comment: The Double structure is used to store floating point attributes using the IEEE 754 64-bit range. Three special values exist for this type: POSITIVE_INFINITY, NEGATIVE_INFINITY, and NaN (Not A Number).

mal:attribute.name: Identifier
mal:attribute.comment: The Identifier structure is used to store an identifier and can be used for indexing. It is a variable-length, unbounded, Unicode string.

mal:attribute.name: Octet
mal:attribute.comment: The Octet structure is used to store 8-bit signed attributes. The permitted range is -128 to 127.

mal:attribute.name: UOctet
mal:attribute.comment: The UOctet structure is used to store 8-bit unsigned attributes. The permitted range is 0 to 255.

mal:attribute.name: Short
mal:attribute.comment: The Short structure is used to store 16-bit signed attributes. The permitted range is -32768 to 32767.

mal:attribute.name: UShort
mal:attribute.comment: The UShort structure is used to store 16-bit unsigned attributes. The permitted range is 0 to 65535.

mal:attribute.name: Integer
mal:attribute.comment: The Integer structure is used to store 32-bit signed attributes. The permitted range is -2147483648 to 2147483647.

mal:attribute.name: UInteger
mal:attribute.comment: The UInteger structure is used to store 32-bit unsigned attributes. The permitted range is 0 to 4294967295.

mal:attribute.name: Long
mal:attribute.comment: The Long structure is used to store 64-bit signed attributes. The permitted range is -9223372036854775808 to 9223372036854775807.

mal:attribute.name: ULong
mal:attribute.comment: The ULong structure is used to store 64-bit unsigned attributes. The permitted range is 0 to 18446744073709551615.

mal:attribute.name: String
mal:attribute.comment: The String structure is used to store String attributes. It is a variable-length, unbounded, Unicode string.

mal:attribute.name: Time
mal:attribute.comment: The Time structure is used to store absolute time attributes. It represents an absolute date and time to millisecond resolution.

mal:attribute.name: FineTime
mal:attribute.comment: The FineTime structure is used to store high-resolution absolute time attributes. It represents an absolute date and time to picosecond resolution.

mal:attribute.name: URI
mal:attribute.comment: The URI structure is used to store URI addresses. It is a variable-length, unbounded, Unicode string.

mal:enumeration.name: InteractionType
mal:enumeration.comment: InteractionType is an enumeration holding the possible interaction pattern types.

mal:enumeration.name: SessionType
mal:enumeration.comment: SessionType is an enumeration holding the session types.

mal:enumeration.name: QoSLevel
mal:enumeration.comment: QoSLevel is an enumeration holding the possible QoS levels.

mal:item.comment: Used for Best Effort QoS Level.

mal:enumeration.name: UpdateType
mal:enumeration.comment: UpdateType is an enumeration holding the possible Update types.

mal:item.comment: Update is notification of the creation of the item.
Update is just a periodic update of the item and has not changed its value.
Update is for a changed value or modification of the item.
Update is notification of the removal of the item.

mal:composite.name: Subscription
mal:composite.comment: The Subscription structure is used when subscribing for updates using the PUBSUB interaction pattern. It contains a single identifier that identifies the subscription being defined and a set of entities being requested.

mal:field.name: subscriptionId
mal:field.comment: The identifier of this subscription.

mal:field.name: entities
mal:field.comment: The list of entities that are being subscribed for by this identified subscription.

mal:composite.name: EntityRequest
mal:composite.comment: The EntityRequest structure is used when subscribing for updates using the PUBSUB interaction pattern.

mal:field.name: subDomain
mal:field.comment: Optional subdomain identifier that is appended to the Message Header domain identifier when requesting entities in a subdomain of this domain.

mal:field.name: allAreas
mal:field.comment: If set to True, then all updates regardless of Area shall be sent.

mal:field.name: allServices
mal:field.comment: If set to True, then all updates regardless of Service shall be sent.

mal:field.name: allOperations
mal:field.comment: If set to True, then all updates regardless of Operation shall be sent.

mal:field.name: onlyOnChange
mal:field.comment: The Boolean denotes that only change updates are to be sent rather than all updates.

mal:field.name: entityKeys
mal:field.comment: The list of entities to be monitored.

mal:composite.name: EntityKey
mal:composite.comment: The EntityKey structure is used to identify an entity in the PUBSUB interaction pattern.

mal:field.name: firstSubKey
mal:field.comment: The first sub-key of the key.

mal:field.name: secondSubKey
mal:field.comment: The second sub-key of the key.

mal:field.name: thirdSubKey
mal:field.comment: The third sub-key of the key.

mal:field.name: fourthSubKey
mal:field.comment: The fourth sub-key of the key.

mal:composite.name: UpdateHeader
mal:composite.comment: The UpdateHeader structure is used by updates using the PUBSUB interaction pattern. It holds information that identifies a single update.

mal:field.name: timestamp
mal:field.comment: Creation timestamp of the update.

mal:field.name: sourceURI
mal:field.comment: URI of the source of the update, usually a PUBSUB provider.

mal:field.name: updateType
mal:field.comment: Type of update being reported.

mal:field.name: key
mal:field.comment: The key of the entity; shall not contain the wildcard value.

mal:composite.name: IdBooleanPair
mal:composite.comment: IdBooleanPair is a simple pair type of an identifier and Boolean value.

mal:field.name: id
mal:field.comment: The Identifier value.

mal:field.name: value
mal:field.comment: The Boolean value.

mal:composite.name: Pair
mal:composite.comment: Pair is a simple composite structure for holding pairs. The pairs can be user-defined attributes.

mal:field.name: first
mal:field.comment: The attribute value for the first element of this pair.

mal:field.name: second
mal:field.comment: The attribute value for the second element of this pair.

mal:composite.name: NamedValue
mal:composite.comment: The NamedValue structure represents a simple pair type of an identifier and abstract attribute value.

mal:field.name: name
mal:field.comment: The Identifier value.

mal:field.name: value
mal:field.comment: The Attribute value.

mal:composite.name: File
mal:composite.comment: The File structure represents a File and holds details about a File. It can also, optionally, hold a BLOB of the file data. The file type is denoted using the internet MIME media types, the list of official MIME types is held at http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/index.html.

mal:field.name: name
mal:field.comment: The file name.

mal:field.name: mimeType
mal:field.comment: The MIME type of the file, NULL if not known.

mal:field.name: creationDate
mal:field.comment: The creation timestamp of the file, NULL if not known.

mal:field.name: modificationDate
mal:field.comment: The last modification timestamp of the file, NULL if not known.

mal:field.name: size
mal:field.comment: The size of the file in Octets, NULL if not known.

mal:field.name: content
mal:field.comment: The contents of the file, NULL if not supplied.

mal:field.name: metaData
mal:field.comment: A list of extra metadata for the file.

mal:error.name: DESTINATION_TRANSIENT
mal:error.comment: Destination middleware reports destination application does not exist.

mal:error.name: AUTHENTICATION_FAIL
mal:error.comment: A failure to authenticate the message correctly.

mal:error.name: AUTHORISATION_FAIL
mal:error.comment: A failure in the MAL to authorise the message.

mal:error.name: ENCRYPTION_FAIL
mal:error.comment: A failure in the MAL to encrypt/decrypt the message.

mal:error.name: UNSUPPORTED_AREA
mal:error.comment: The destination does not support the service area.

mal:error.name: UNSUPPORTED_OPERATION
mal:error.comment: The destination does not support the operation.

mal:error.name: UNSUPPORTED_VERSION
mal:error.comment: The destination does not support the service version.

mal:error.name: BAD_ENCODING
mal:error.comment: The destination was unable to decode the message.

mal:error.name: INCORRECT_STATE
mal:error.comment: The destination was not in the correct state for the received message.

mal:error.name: TOO_MANY
mal:error.comment: Maximum number of subscriptions or providers of a broker has been exceeded.
